ONE Top Ten Reasons Why the Holidays Suck

[I]0-i ’m fat . As much as [I]0-i hate to admit it , the point was driven [home]260-home with brutal clarity by [Granny Gums]56-granny gums when [she]56-granny gums saw [me]0-i at Thanksgiving and said with a cackle , “ Looks like [somebody]1960-somebody already ate the turkey ! ”[56-granny gums] [I]0-i ’d blame it on [her]56-granny gums dementia , but the photos [Mom]57-mom sent [me]0-i this morning offer irrefutable proof that sometime over the past few years , [I]0-i have acquired an alarming similarity to a barnyard animal . Snow . [Manhattan]2-manhattan snow is never white . It ’s a drab , listless brown , like [my]0-i hair . ( Note to self : call [the hairdresser]261-the hairdresser . Red ? ? ? ) Christmas movies . Why is [Home]260-home Alone considered a good holiday family movie ? [Kevin McCallister]58-kevin mccallister and [[his]58-kevin mccallister siblings]263-his siblings should be adopted by [concerned relatives]264-concerned relatives . And It ’s a Wonderful Life ? [I]0-i ’m sorry , but [someone]265-someone has to say it : [George Bailey]59-george bailey is [a dick]266-a dick . There are so many examples of [his]59-george bailey dickery during that movie , it ’s another list altogether . One of [my]0-i favorites quotes : “ [You]267-you call this [a happy family]1961-a happy family ? Why do [we]1962-we have to have [all these kids]1963-all these kids ? ”[0-i] [I]0-i can feel the love , [Superdad]60-superdad . Christmas shopping . Also known as Standing in Line until [You]267-you Die , Christmas shopping includes three of [my]0-i all - time favorite things : [screaming children]268-screaming children , [angry soccer moms]269-angry soccer moms , and [me]0-i aimlessly wandering around [a crowded public space]270-a crowded public space until [I]0-i ’m drenched in sweat . December in [a mall]271-a mall is like [The Hunger Games]3-the hunger games meets [Lord of the Flies]272-lord of the flies , completed with a reenactment of Death Race in [the parking lot]273-the parking lot when [you]267-you finally try to leave after twelve hours of spending money [you]267-you do n’t have . Fun times . Office Christmas parties . Oh , great ! Awkward , forced conversations with [coworkers]274-coworkers [I]0-i want to unfriend on Facebook ! Christmas music . It is awful and depressing . See number nine .

Once upon a time , in [a land not so far away]1909-a land not so far away , [A duckling born to a family of swans]1910-a duckling born to a family of swans Was mistakenly led astray . ACKNOWLEDGMENTS This is the fun part of the book , after all the cursing and crying is done and the bleeding has almost completely stopped . Writing a novel has several things in common with childbirth , not the least of which is the overwhelming relief at a successful delivery after many months of uncomfortable gestation . ( [I]0-i do n’t have [kids]2502-kids , but the comparison was irresistible . ) Before [I]0-i get to the thank - yous , [I]0-i want to tell [you]1917-you about [a close friend [I]0-i had when [I]0-i was [a teenager]1919-a teenager]1918-a close friend i had when i was a teenager . [We]1920-we ’ll call [her]1918-a close friend i had when i was a teenager [Eva]249-eva ( not [her]1918-a close friend i had when i was a teenager real name ) . [Eva]249-eva was [the most beautiful girl [I]0-i have ever seen]1921-the most beautiful girl i have ever seen , even to this day , some thirty years later . [She]249-eva was of Irish descent , with long , dark hair , enormous crystal - blue eyes , and skin so perfect it glowed . Tall , graceful , and always [the most popular girl throughout [junior high and high school]1923-junior high and high school]1922-the most popular girl throughout junior high and high school , [she]249-eva was universally loved . [She]249-eva was also filled with intense self - loathing . Convinced [her]249-eva perfect body was fat , [she]249-eva dieted rigorously , eating only saltines , rice cakes , and celery , until [she]249-eva grew so thin [her]249-eva period stopped . [She]249-eva worked out like a machine , running miles every day before school . [She]249-eva was obsessed with how [she]249-eva looked , down to the tiniest detail , and would spend hours in front of the mirror , trying on new outfits , picking at imaginary blemishes , learning new makeup techniques to contour already - hollow cheeks . [[Her]249-eva mother]477-her mother could n’t be bothered to notice . [She]249-eva was too busy drinking chardonnay . [[Her]249-eva father]1925-her father — [[her]249-eva parents]1926-her parents were divorced — liked to tell [Eva]249-eva [she]249-eva better get married quick because [she]249-eva was too dumb for college . [Eva]249-eva scored a 1510 on the SAT , in the ninety - ninth percentile . When [I]0-i told [her]249-eva [she]249-eva could get into almost any college with that test score , that [she]249-eva could go to [Harvard]48-harvard if [she]249-eva wanted , [she]249-eva laughed . [She]249-eva was too dumb for college , [she]249-eva said . [Everyone]342-everyone knew that . It was a mistake . The day [she]249-eva turned eighteen , [Eva]249-eva got breast implants . Several years later , [I]0-i got a phone call from [[my]0-i mother]287-my mother . Sit down , [she]287-my mother said . [I]0-i have terrible news . [Eva]249-eva had been murdered . [[Her]249-eva much - older husband]1935-her much - older husband had poisoned [her]249-eva over the course of many months with overdoses of prescription medication . [He]1935-her much - older husband ’d buried [her]249-eva before even telling [[her]249-eva parents]1926-her parents [she]249-eva was dead . The tragedy of [Eva]249-eva is one of huge potential lost to neglect and negativity . [People]343-people can internalize even the most obvious falsehoods if [they]343-people ’re repeated often enough . When [you]1938-you ’re surrounded by negativity , that ’s what [you]1938-you tend to absorb . [You]1938-you become what [you]1938-you ’re most often told [you]1938-you are . [I]0-i wish [I]0-i could go back in time and tell [Eva]249-eva how much [I]0-i loved [her]249-eva , how smart [she]249-eva was , how much [she]249-eva had to offer [the world]339-the world , but [I]0-i ca n’t . But every time [I]0-i meet [a young girl]1940-a young girl , [I]0-i want to hug [her]1940-a young girl close and tell [her]1940-a young girl [she]1940-a young girl ’s so much more special than [she]1940-a young girl realizes . That [her]1940-a young girl worth as [a person]2406-a person and [her]1940-a young girl looks are two entirely different things . If [you]1938-you have [young daughters]1942-young daughters at [home]260-home , [I]0-i hope [you]1938-you ’ll do the same . ABOUT [THE AUTHOR]255-the author

[A former headhunter]1958-a former headhunter , [J.T. Geissinger]52-j.t. geissinger is the author of more than a dozen novels of paranormal romance , romantic suspense , and contemporary romance , including [Melt]252-melt for [You]1951-you and Burn for [You]1951-you in [her]255-the author Slow Burn series . [She]255-the author is the recipient of a Prism Award for Best First Book and a Golden Quill Award for Best Paranormal / Urban Fantasy . [She]255-the author ’s a two - time finalist for the RITA Award from [the Romance Writers of [America]51-america]1959-the romance writers of america , and [her]255-the author works have been finalists for the Booksellers ’ Best , National Readers ’ Choice , and Daphne du Maurier Awards . Find [her]255-the author on the web at www.jtgeissinger.com .
